name: Vaccinations
description: Find out about vaccinations for babies, children and adults, including why they're important and how to get them.
headline: Vaccinations

mainEntityOfPage.headline: View vaccinations in your GP health record
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: NHS vaccinations and when to have them
mainEntityOfPage.text: Check the NHS vaccination schedule to find out what vaccines are recommended for you or your child
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Why vaccination is important and the safest way to protect yourself
mainEntityOfPage.text: Find out how vaccines work, what they contain and common side effects
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Booking your child's vaccination appointment
mainEntityOfPage.text: Find out how to book vaccination appointments for your child
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Vaccination tips for parents
mainEntityOfPage.text: Advice about how to help your child's vaccination appointment go smoothly and what to expect afterwards
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Vaccinations in pregnancy
mainEntityOfPage.text: Advice about vaccinations during pregnancy, including recommended vaccines such as the whooping cough vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Travel vaccinations
mainEntityOfPage.text: Advice about getting vaccinated before travelling abroad and information about common travel vaccines such as the yellow fever vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: 4-in-1 pre-school booster
mainEntityOfPage.text: For children aged 3 years, 4 months old to help protect against 4 serious illnesses
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: 6-in-1 vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies when they're 8, 12 and 16 weeks old to help protect against 6 serious illnesses
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: BCG vaccine for tuberculosis (TB)
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies, children and adults at higher risk of getting tuberculosis (TB)
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Chickenpox vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For people in close contact with someone at a higher risk of getting seriously ill from chickenpox
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: COVID-19 vaccination
mainEntityOfPage.text: For people at higher risk from COVID-19, including adults aged 65 and over and people with certain health conditions
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Flu vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For people at higher risk from flu, including adults aged 65 and over and people with certain health conditions
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Flu vaccine for children
mainEntityOfPage.text: For most children to help stop them catching or spreading flu
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Hepatitis B vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies, children and adults at higher risk of getting hepatitis B
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Hib/MenC vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies when theyâ€™re 1 year old to help protect against Hib and meningitis
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: HPV vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For all children aged 12 to 13 years old and people at higher risk of getting HPV
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: MenACWY vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For all teenagers and people at higher risk of getting meningitis
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: MenB vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies when they're 8 weeks, 16 weeks and 1 year old to help protect against meningitis
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: MMR vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For children when they're 1 year old and 3 years, 4 months old to help protect against measles, mumps and rubella
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Pneumococcal vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For people at higher risk of pneumococcal infections, such as babies and adults aged 65 and over
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Rotavirus vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For babies when they're 8 and 12 weeks old to help protect against a common stomach bug called rotavirus
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Shingles vaccine
mainEntityOfPage.text: For people at higher risk from shingles, including adults turning 65 years old and those aged 70 to 79
mainEntityOfPage.name: link

mainEntityOfPage.headline: Td/IPV vaccine (3-in-1 teenage booster)
mainEntityOfPage.text: For all teenagers and people at higher risk of tetanus, diphtheria or polio
mainEntityOfPage.name: link
